str.o: Extensions
List of URL extensions that indicate that the document is a Perl script.
Roxen Perl Directory
This is the name of a directory with Roxen-related Perl stuff. It should normally point to `perl' in the Roxen server directory, but you may want to point it elsewhere if you want to modify the code.
Show Backtraces
This setting decides whether to deliver a backtrace in the document if an error is caught while a script runs.
Enable Perl Tag
This setting decides whether to enable parsing of Perl code in RXML pages, in <perl>..</perl> containers.
Script output

How to treat script output. HTML means treat it as a plain HTML document. RXML is similar, but passes it through the RXML parser before returning it to the client. HTTP is the traditional CGI output style, where the script is responsible for producing the HTTP headers before the document, as well as the main document data.
RXML-parse tag results
Whether to RXML parse tag results or not.
Perl Helper
Path to the helper program used to start a Perl subprocess. The default for this setting is `perl/bin/ntperl.pl'.
Path to the helper program used to start a Perl subprocess. The default for this setting is `perl/bin/perlrun'.
Parallel scripts

Number of scripts/tags that may be evaluated in parallel. Don't set this higher than necessary, since it may cause the server to block (by using all available threads). The default for this setting is 3.
Cache output
Whether to cache the result of scripts. This is usually not desirable, so the default for this setting is No.
Run Perl as...

User and group to run Perl scripts and tags as. The default for this option is `nobody:*'. Note that Roxen can't change user ID unless it has sufficient permissions to do so. `*' means `use same as Roxen'.
